definition: Angela Merkel (1954-), German CDU politician, chancellor from 2005
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: For Merkel and the German political establishment, it's the best of both worlds.
sentences.chinese: 對於默克爾和德國的政治體制，這是兩全其美的。

sentences.english: A big sticking point will be Merkel's insistence on renegotiating the Lisbon treaty.
sentences.chinese: 目前的關鍵在於默克爾堅持要修訂里斯本條約。

sentences.english: Merkel is as soft as chewed bubble gum. Pathetic woman.
sentences.chinese: 默克爾就像嚼過的泡泡糖一樣軟，可憐的女人。

sentences.english: It is the first time Ms Merkel has confronted her critics head-on.
sentences.chinese: 這是默克爾首次正面迎擊她的批評者。

sentences.english: TO CALL her embattled would be to exaggerate.
sentences.chinese: 說默克爾受到指責圍攻，那也說得太誇張了。

sentences.english: Merkel noted that Germany-China economic and trade cooperation is also the cooperation between people.
sentences.chinese: 默克爾表示，德中經貿合作也是人與人之間的合作。

sentences.english: Merkle told me, I don't want nanotechnology to evolve.
sentences.chinese: 默克爾告訴我，我不希望納米技術進化。

sentences.english: Is Harman leading the charge to replace Brown?
sentences.chinese: 是哈爾曼在計劃代替默克爾嗎？

sentences.english: A German official confirmed that Mr. Ackermann proposed guests' names to the chancellery.
sentences.chinese: 一名德國官員證實，阿克曼向默克爾提交了賓客名單。

sentences.english: Both events will transform Mrs Merkel's chancellorship.
sentences.chinese: 這兩起事件都改變了默克爾的執政生涯。

sentences.english: Merkel also faces strong opposition from the anti-immigration Alternative for Deutschland (AFD) party.
sentences.chinese: 默克爾還面臨着反移民的德國新選擇黨的強烈反對。

sentences.english: At invitation, Premier Wen met with Chancellor Merkel in Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 溫總理應邀赴柏林與默克爾總理會晤。

sentences.english: Mrs Merkel and Mr Sarkozy did not say how recapitalisation will proceed;
sentences.chinese: 默克爾和薩科齊並沒有說明資本調整將如何進行。

sentences.english: The bomb was safely defused at Mrs Merkel's office in Berlin, and no one was hurt.
sentences.chinese: 這枚炸彈已經在柏林默克爾的辦公室排爆，無人受傷。

sentences.english: What will Ms Merkel boast in 2009?
sentences.chinese: 但是到2009年，默克爾拿什麼來自賣自誇呢？

sentences.english: This could lead to the immediate switch-off of the country’s two oldest plants, Mrs Merkel added.
sentences.chinese: 默克爾補充稱，德國最老舊的兩座核電站將立即關閉。

definition: Netanyahu (name)/Benjamin Netanyahu (1949-), Israeli Likud politician, prime minister 1996-1999 and from 2009
François Hollande (1954-), French Socialist politician, president of France 2012-2017
